reviewText:
I was really excited about this game, and I'm a little upset to be giving this a bad review.

First off, it reminds me a little of Pokemon and a bit of harvest moon, so that is a double win. But, it just wasn't doing it for me.

The concept, visual art and music in this game is fine and dandy, but the English is broken (or just the way it is phrased, seems off or weird to a native speaker) and just breaks the immersion for me.
A big part in gaming for me is the plot, storyline, and character development. So if I am unable to gauge how the character is even feeling from what is being said, then that's a problem.

It's probably just me though. I'm sure fans from other parts of the world who aren't particular about grammar will enjoy this.

reviewText: Nusakana is a weird one, in a good way. It's a JRPG with adventure and romance sim aspects, and it reminds me a lot of a more fleshed out the park portions of the Pokémon games. Great artwork, good characters and most importantly a big mysterious island to explore for its secrets!\n\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P8qiQUua2iE

reviewText:
First of all English not my native language so please bear my mistake.

I heard about Nusakana on facebook page and see there many girl on the game so I'm interested and gave a try.

600Mb for a RM Game is plenty big, but when I started playing is worth of it, there many custom asset that used to make this game different from RTP game scattered on the steam.

The game is self is pretty fun, when I started to play I way to lazy to grind the level so instead I wandering around, explore every map as possible while picked a loot. After several hour of wandering and starving (I never feed the MC) I use the loot I get to fulfill the quest and get some money.

With lot of money on my hand I buy the best equipment I can get (the Gun is awesome) and finally started to grind my level. It was weird way to play but Nusakana give me freedom to do this and I like it.


Pro =

This game gave you certain degree of a freedom.

There are many pretty girl to recruit, and each of them is have distinct personality and main skill, I like several of them especially Orca (dat White sukumizu and eyepatch combination is awesome).

There plenty thing to do in this game from fishing, crafting, or just wandering around while searching for an event, when I think there no more thing to do an event or sidequest is pop up.

About the grammar, I actually not really bothered by it since my english not so good to became grammar Nazi, one thing I realized that is only the native nusakana people who speak broken english, I think the developer is make them speak broken English on purpose that it's actually funny because in my country some of the native do speak like that.

reviewText:
Nusakana is a prime example of the perfect utilization of RPGMaker. Although it’s definitely not your atypical RPG it’s a refreshing take on the genre that offers a lot to those who give it an opportunity.  The game incorporates the traditional components of a JRPG in RPGMaker style but it also features critical components of an adventure and romance game as well. Some have already compared it to Pokemon meets Harvest Moon and in many ways I would have to agree that that is probably the best way to describe the game. I thought that Studio Namaapa really worked hard to make a cohesive art and audio style befitting of the game. My favorite aspect of the game was the level of freedom that it offers. Too many RPGMaker games feel locked in – the game designer expects you to do certain things in a certain order and don’t offer much leeway. Instead, Nusakana allows you to explore, adventure and hunt at your leisure. Thankfully the world is of a significant size giving you a lot of areas to explore.

If there were flaws in the game it’s that the English translation isn’t the highest quality. Those of you playing from countries where English is a second language will not have an issue playing but it could have been worked on and perfected a lot more than what it is. It’s also arguable that although the developers did a great job in creating an open world in a RPGMaker game that perhaps a better level of concentration in developing the story would have been wise. Don’t get me wrong I enjoyed the open nature of the game immensely but it felt that the main story was missing a lot of what was perhaps initially intended.

In all, I understand the negative reviews on Steam although I myself would place myself into the significantly higher percentage of people who enjoyed the game. Nusakana can be recommended for those who enjoy rock solid RPGMaker games and JRPGs. There’s more than enough content in the game to be discovered for it to be a good purchase.
voteText: 11 of 16 people (69%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
There are too many missing core elements of gameplay to make your game actually an enjoyable experience. I felt there was no plot, no general storyline, only odd side-quests. And while roaming around talking to everyone, might be fun for some, it gives you no reward. Some areas of improvement are graphics, the text-bars could even be on a transparent color, (Blue signifies a win95 color scheme, we are in the 21st century), and battle balancing. Also you should be able to switch characters mid-battle or use items without costing a turn. Starting out in the game and I realise the reason for forcing the player to the inn, instead of allowing them to walk there; but you have side-quests that are deceptive because you obviously cant beat them because you die in two hits.
You should always ask a second opinion before you present some thing to the public, especially if you are asking for support. If it had gone to early access I feel like they could have asked the community for ideas and suggestions, we can always improve oursleves. They have a tough road ahead of themselves, most gamers get that, with going up against the big dogs that have done it better and been around longer.
I will say I do like the humour and I do like the pixel art. They did a good job with the music track/sound, although as others have said the grammar is off, although I dont mind that as long as I have a reason to play. But you need to show more heart and originality because currently it is lacking badly. As I say if they had brought it to early access you could have asked the community for support but as a fully released game, it needs to be fully done. And while it might be in one persons eyes, it isnt worth the price point.
How many times do we say it. You cant just put items in a game and expect that alone to add to the games core content. You need to stand out and bring some thing NEW to the table.

reviewText:
First impression for this game so amazing !
I think this is extra ordinary from rpgmaker games.
This is very polished game, i love how they are make the content itself.

Pro :
-> Nusakana have a lot of content ! like alchemy, fishing, battle and more !
-> Beautiful music, this is make me love Nusakana.
-> All girls very cute, especially Orca.
-> You can do everything in this game. The Open World game with refresh theme. (Remind me Digimon World)
-> This is not about the chosen one or over powered hero who beat the god !, you just ordinary human who want to trip in Nusakana.
-> Dating sims, i love how meet Orca <3. She's my waifu !
-> I love the setting in this game, you can re-mapping your controller by yourself.

Cons :
-> You must exploring by yourself to find the clue. (It's ok for me, but dunno with other players).

Overall :
This game have interesting content and world, if you love Harvest Moon or Digimon World 1,  you must play this game !
Nusakana theme too love able for me and unforgettable, i like the idea to make various version of Nusakana theme.

You can learn about Indonesian too, such as the food, drink and more !
I will play this game until finish !
Because Orca waiting for me <3

I don't know why some people give a negative review but they are just playing one hours.
You must try to explore Nusakana World, to reveal all features.
You must unlock the features by yourself, just like play Harvest Moon or DMW1.

reviewText:
Just played for about a couple of hours.
A relatively fun to play game, combining open world with JRPG, and dating sim, of all things!
Pros:
- You can do whatever you want in this game! No restraints!
- Nice Music, changes according to the day-night cycle.
- A good looking battle system.
- Indonesian languange, culture and food! Also, mangosteen pills.
- Nice looking art style.
- It's always a satisfying feeling when you figure out/ discover how to complete a quest.

Cons:
- There is no indication when the cycle is about to change. That can be annoying sometimes.
-  Some foreigners may not understand the Indonesian lingo.

Overall, I think it's an okay game. I'll definitely try to finish this game when I have the time.
Regardless, I think it's pretty amazing that a two-man team can finish this game. Indonesians, even!
